2025 Tea for Harmony: Yaji” series events kick off in Colombo

Market movement at International Auction Centers this week

Currency – As of 28th May 2025

Elevation Average (May 03rd Sale)

Rs.1,044.89     USD 3.49

Quantity Sold during the period 19th - 24th May 2025

Tea Tech Tips

Pack Teas to retain the shape of the bag. Bulging bags will be
discounted by the buyers.

Crop & Weather (For the period 20th - 27th May 2025)

The Western and Nuwara Eliya planting districts experienced showers
throughout the week. The Department of Meteorology forecasts heavy
rains to be expected in both regions.

The Uva/Udapussellawa's experienced bright mornings. Strong winds
are expected in both districts.

The Low grown's reported rains throughout the week. Heavy showers
are to be expected in the Low grown districts.

All regions maintained their crop intakes except for the Western high
and Low grown planting districts which reported a decline.

Weather Forecast (For the period 29th May  - 04th June2025)

This Week's Market Movement at Colombo Tea Auction

Order of Sale this week

Demand: Ex-Estate met with selective and easier demand following quality whilst lower
demand prevailed for Low Growns.

High Grown Teas

BOP: Best Western’s – A few selected invoices were firm to dearer,
whilst others were irregular and easier by Rs.50/- per kg and at times
more. In the Below Best category, a few selected invoices appreciated
Rs.50/- per kg, whilst others dropped by a similar margin. Teas at the
lower end were firm to dearer by Rs.20-40/- per kg. Nuwara Eliya’s
were lower by Rs.50/- per kg. Uda Pussellawa’s were firm to dearer by
Rs. 20-30/- per kg. Uva’s were firm to dearer by Rs.20-30 per kg.

BOPF: Best Western’s – A few selected invoices appreciated following a
special inquiry, whilst others were irregular and easier following quality.
In the Below Best category, a few selected invoices were dearer by
Rs.20-40 per kg, whilst others were irregular and easier. Plainer sorts
were irregular and easier. Nuwara Eliya’s held firm. Uda Pussellawa’s
were barely steady. Uva’s were lower by Rs.50/- per kg.

Medium Grown Teas

BOP1 - Select best and best were dearer by Rs. 50/- per kg whilst all
others held firm.Select best moved up by Rs. 50/- per kg. Best held
firm. Below best and others lost by Rs. 50/- per kg.

OP1 - Select best and best remained unchanged. Below best were
dearer by Rs. 50/- per kg. Others held firm.

PEK -  Select best and best lost by Rs. 50/- per kg. Below best were
lower by Rs. 100/- per kg whilst others were lower by Rs. 50/- per kg.

PEK1 - Select best appreciated by Rs. 50/- per kg. Best held firm.
Below best and others were lower by Rs. 50/- per kg.

OP/OPA - Overall, lost by Rs.40/- per kg.Select best were lower by Rs.
50/- per kg whilst all others were easier by Rs. 20/- per kg.

FBOP - Select best maintained. Best and below best were lower by Rs.
50/- per kg. Others held firm.

FBOPF1 - Select best remained unchanged whilst all others
appreciated by Rs.50/- per kg.Select best held firm whilst all others
were lower by Rs. 50/- per kg.

CTC Teas

HIGH GROWN
BP1s – Hardly any offerings.
PF1s – Irregular and easier. 

MEDIUM GROWN
BP1s – Irregular.
PF1s – Teas in the higher price bracket dropped by Rs. 20-40/- per kg,
whilst others maintained. 

LOW GROWN
BP1s – Irregular.
PF1s – Lower by Rs.50/- per kg and more.

Low Grown Teas

BOP1 - Select best  were firm whilst best and below best were firm to
lower. Poorer sorts held firm to dearer.

OP1 - Select best were firm. Best and below best were irregular. Poorer
sorts were firm to dearer.

OP/OPA  - Select best were dearer. Best and below best were irregular.
Poorer sorts were firm.

PEKOE/PEKOE1 - Select best PEK's were firm whilst best and below
best were easier. Select best and best PEK1's were firm whilst below
best were firm to lower.

FBOP/FBOP1 - Select best and best were firm, whilst others were
lower.

BOP - Select best and best types were firm to dearer whilst others
were marginally lower.

BOPF - All-round lower.

FBOPF/FBOPF1 - All around FBOPF’s were lower. Select best and best
FBOPF1's were firm whilst Below best were lower to last.

Off Grades

FGS/FGS1 - High Growns were irregular. Medium Growns gained by
Rs.10-20/- per kg. Low Growns held firm. CTC's were irregular and
easier.

BM - Cleaner varieties were firm to dearer by Rs. 10-20/- per kg. Below
best and the bottom too moved up by Rs. 20/- per kg.

BP -  In general, appreciated by Rs. 50-100/- per kg.

BOP1A - Select best were firm to dearer by Rs.20/- per kg. Below best
together with the poorer sorts moved up by Rs. 10-20/- per kg.

DUST Grades

DUST1 - Best and Below best were lower by Rs.50-60/- per kg, CTC's
were irregular. Best and Below best Low growns appreciated by Rs.20
-30/- per kg.

DUST - Cleaner secondaries and low growns were lower by Rs.20-40/-
per kg.

Top Prices  - Sale No.20 of 27th / 28th May 2025

Future Sales Information (Sale No.21 of 03rd & 04th June 2025)

  Awaiting Sale – Catalogue Details

SALE NO. 23 – 17TH & 18TH JUNE 2025

closed on the 29th May 2025

 

SALE NO. 24 – 24TH & 25TH JUNE 2025

Ex-Estate catalogue and Main Sale catalogues are scheduled to be
closed on the 05th June 2025

 

SALE NO. 25 – 02ND & 03RD JULY 2025

Ex-Estate catalogue and Main Sale catalogues are scheduled to be
closed on the 12th July 2025

 

Elevation Wise – Statistics – Colombo Auction Averages

World Tea Production (In Million Kilos)

Other Markets

Mombasa Auction of 19th / 20th May 2025

Fairly improved general demand at irregular levels for the 206,458
packages (14,074,519.00 kilos) on offer; 33.70% was unsold.

Pakistan Packers were active but at lower levels with more enquiry from
Yemen and other Middle Eastern countries. Kazakhstan and other CIS
states lent strong support  with some participation from Bazaar.
Afghanistan were active with less enquiry from UK. Egyptian Packers
lent good support at steady rates with some interest from Russia.
Sudan were absent while South Sudan maintained activity. Local
Packers reduced enquiry with Somalia active at the lower end of the
market.

 

LEAF GRADES (M2 & M3)

BP1: Best - Saw very irregular interest and varied between USC16
dearer with some teas USC42 and USC80 above previous levels to
easier by USC26 and some lines were further discounted by USC38 and
USC59. Brighter - Were up to USC19 dearer to easier by up to USC15.
Mediums - KTDA mediums were irregular varying between USC12
dearer with some invoices up to USC22 above last rates to easier by up
to USC17 while better plantation mediums were well sought after
appreciating by up to USC42. Lower Medium - Were steady to USC5
dearer to easier by up to USC12. Plainer - Improved absorption at firm
to USC10 above previous rates to easier by up to USC5.

PF1: Best - Met irregular enquiry ranging between steady to USC22
dearer to easier by up to USC14.

 Brighter - Mostly shed by up to USC28 but select invoices were up to
USC2 above previous rates.

 Mediums - KTDA mediums were irregular and varied between steady
to dearer by up to USC7 to easier by up to USC16. Plantation mediums
were firm to USC4 above previous levels to easier by up to USC7. Lower
Medium - Lost up to USC16 but some invoices gained by up to USC6.
Plainer - Irregular enquiry and ranged between steady to USC31 dearer
to easier by up to USC5.

 

DUST GRADES (M1)

PDUST: Best - Were well absorbed at irregular rates ranging between
USC16 dearer to easier by up to USC20. Brighter - Irregular and varied
between mostly dearer by up to USC19 with some lines easier by up to
USC4. Mediums - KTDA mediums were USC15 above last levels to
easier by up to USC10 with plantation mediums irregularly shedding by
up to USC15. Lower Medium - Discounted by up to USC18. Plainer -
Mostly dearer by up to USC9 to USC1 below previous levels.

DUST1: Best - Saw improved enquiry ranging between firm to USC22
dearer to easier by USC4. Brighter - Steady to USC12 above previous
levels to easier by up to USC15. Mediums - KTDA mediums saw
irregular enquiry at USC12 dearer to mostly easier by up to USC20 with
plantation mediums up to USC22 above previous levels to easier by up
to USC5. Lower Medium - Lost up to USC15 but select lines gained by
USC4. Plainer - Irregular and varied between firm to mostly dearer by
up to USC6 to easier by up to USC8

SECONDARY GRADES (S1)

In the Secondary Catalogues, best BPs tended easier with others steady
while PFs were firm to irregularly dearer. Clean well sorted coloury
Fannings were steady to dearer with similar DUSTs selling at around
previous rates. Other Fannings tended dearer while DUSTs held value.
BMFs were well absorbed.

(Courtesy - Africa Tea Brokers Ltd)

Jakarta Auction of 19th May 2025

MARKET: The total CTC leaf teas sold this week was 68.73
%(1,280,621.31kgs) of the total offering of 1,863,312.73Kgs.

BEST: Best liquoring larger broken sold irregularly following quality,
medium and smaller broken grades sold dearer following quality. There
were very limited fanning grade on offer. Local and Regional packagers
continued to be fairly active.

GOOD: Larger broken sold barely steady, medium and smaller broken at
the bottom end sold barely steady whilst select few invoices sold dearer
following quality. Very limited fanning grade was on offer and fetched
dearer prices following quality and competition. Regional packagers,
upcountry buyers were fairly active.

BETTER MEDIUM & MEDIUM: Larger broken eased by Rs 4 to 6, The
top end medium and smaller broken sold barely steady to easier by Rs 2
to 3 whilst the bottom end in this category declined sharply by Rs 4 to 6.
The prices continued to show no disparity between both the categories
especially on the medium and smaller broken grades. Fanning grade on
the better medium category fetched steady prices whilst the medium
category sold easier by Rs 3 to 6. Major blenders and Western India
Packateers were fairly active. Selective buying was seen from the
upcountry and local buyers. Exporters were fairly active on on cleaner,
blacker fanning. Larger broken continue to meet with selective buying
from exporters.

PLAINERS: Larger broken grades declined in value by Rs 4 to 6, the
remainders eased by Rs 4 to 8 or more. Larger percentage of teas
remain unsold in this segment. Limited buying from exporters. Major
blenders were very choosy and internal buyers were selective along
with the upcountry buyers.

BUYING PATTERN: The major blenders off take was 50.64% of the
total CTC leaf sold.

 

ORTHODOX LEAF

DEMAND: Good but selective demand.

 MARKET: Select well made clean high grown whole leaf sold steady to
easier following quality, others faced withdrawals. Other category sold
at irregular levels, the bottom end of this category saws some out lots.
Broken grade of the high grown category sold around last sold levels
with select invoices fetching dearer prices whilst the others sold barely
steady to easier.Fanning grades were barely steady to easier.

BUYING PATTERN: Exporters were selective this week with up country
buyers continuing to be fairly active closely following quality.

 

CTC DUST

DEMAND: Fair demand.

MARKET: CTC dust offer this week was at 509,730.46Kgs of which
388,707.22kgs were sold (76.26%).

 There were no bolder dust on offer in the best teas , other grades sold
irregular and easier closely following quality. Good category teas sold
irregularly easier. Better medium & medium teas were barely steady to
easier by Rs 2 to 3. Plainer teas sold easier by Rs 2 to 6.

BUYING PATTERN: Major blenders were fairly active. Regional and
local packeteers were selective along with the Up country and the local
buyers . Exporters were fairly active on the bolder dust especially on
cleaner and blacker sorts.

ORTHODOX DUST

DEMAND: Good demand.

MARKET: Primary dusts sold at irregular and dearer levels following
quality, secondaries sold at irregular levels.

BUYING PATTERN: Regional & local packateers were fairly active on
primary dusts. Exporters were selective on the secondary dusts.

(Courtesy - J.Thomas & Co. Pvt. Ltd)

Bangladesh Auction of 26th May 2025

CTC LEAF: 25,948 packages of tea on offer met with a strong demand.

BROKENS/FANNINGS: Well made good liquoring types met with a
stronger demand at mostly dearer rates and could be quoted between
Tk.280/- and Tk.310/-. Below best were also a fairly strong market and
were firm to slightly dearer selling between Tk.240/- and Tk.260/-. All
other varieties were in good demand and were generally firm and these
could be quoted between Tk.200/- and Tk.220/-. BLF teas sold quite
well between Tk.160 and Tk.234/-.

DUST: 5,274 packages of tea on offer met with a good demand. Good
liquoring Dusts sold well at around last levels. Their Mediums were also
fully firm to slightly dearer closely following quality. Plain/BLF Dusts
were well competed for and prices appreciated on quality. Blenders lent
good support with fair interest from the Loose tea buyers.

COMMENTS: A stronger demand prevailed this week with the better
sorts fetching good competition. Blenders lent useful support with more
interest from the Loose tea buyers.

Dusts sold well.

(Courtesy - National Brokers Limited)

Malawi Auction of 13th May 2025

There was less and selective interest for the 7740 packages on offer at
firm to easier rates.
BP1 were up to 3USC easier where sold.
PF1 met selective interest and were 15USC below valuation where sold.
PD were neglected.
D1 - Selected invoices fetched last levels. PF1SC held firm.
Secondaries were all taken out with no bids

Kolkata Auction of 15th May 2025

KOLKATA SALE CTC MARKET

Assams tending easier following decline in quality and also seeing some
withdrawals. Medium and plainer Dooars selling around last levels.

 

BUYING PATTERN:

Western India: Supporting the better teas

HUL : Good support

TCPL: Selective so far

Exporters : Fair enquiry

Other Internal/Local: Operating

 

KOLKATA SALE ORTHODOX MARKET

Market opened to strong demand. Well made Whole leaf and Larger
Brokens selling at  firm rates. Well made Smaller Brokens and cleaner
Secondaries irregular around last  levels. Remainder Whole leaf,
Brokens and browner stalkier Secondaries showing a seasonal decline
irregular and at times tending lower. Leafy Fannings selling readily.

 

BUYING PATTERN:

Middle East : Active

CIS:  Good Support

 

KOLKATA SALE DUST MARKET

Market opened to good demand. Dust selling firm to occasionally
dearer. PD grades barely steady noticing few outlots at times.

 

BUYING PATTERN:

HUL: Mainstay

Western India: Good Support

Local Internal: Operated

 

(Courtesy - J Thomas & Company Private Limited)

Guwahati Auction of 13th May 2025

Market: CTC

There was fair demand. Nominal quantity of improved varieties sold at
firm to occasionally dearer rates. Remainder were irregular and easier.
Browner sorts witnessed withdrawals.

Buying Pattern: CTC.

HUL, Western India, North India buyers lent fair support.. TCPL
participated selectively. Exporters operated on the larger brokens.

 

Market: DUST

There was fair general demand. Select better liquoring sorts sold at firm
to occasionally dearer. Remainder were irregular and easier following
quality. Brown / plainer varieties witnessed withdrawals.

Buying Pattern: DUST

HUL participated actively on the better liquoring sorts. Western India,
North India buyers operated.

(Courtesy - Associated Brokers Pvt. Ltd – Guwahati)
